activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leland D. Lindvig

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:33 AM Defendant Leland D. Lindvig in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Leland D. Lindvig.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dadoun speaks about needing more information from older cases and waives the preliminary hearing. LL agrees with waiving the preliminary hearing. 

Attorney Harper has filed the  information that bring forth that  same charges. Attorney Dadoun stands mute. 

Attorney Dadoun speaks about filing a motion within 60 days. Court states that all motions need to be filed by 11/18/22.

Attorney Dadoun withdraws the prior motion for bill of particulars.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
4:17 PM Defendant Leland D. Lindvig in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Leland D. Lindvig. Attorney Dadoun state that they will not be moving forward with the preliminary hearing. Attorney Dadoun speaks about priors of her client that haven't had any attorney's on. Attorney Harper doesn't object to a reset and speaks about treatment court. Court will reset the preliminary hearing. LL waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:13 PM Defendant Leland D. Lindvig in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Leland D. Lindvig.  Attorney Dadoun asks for a reset of the preliminary hearing. Attorney Dadoun waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant must pay $1,200 by 09/29/22 to the Clerk of Court office.

At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk.

3:21 PM Defendant Leland D. Lindvig in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. LL asks about a court appoint attorney. 
3:36 PM Same appearances. Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Dadoun. Court states that the defendant must paid $1,200 within the next week.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:51 PM Defendant Leland D. Lindvig in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. LL has received the complaint. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about counsel and goes over the defendant rights. Court set preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:02 PM LL appears by phone. Attorney Harper appears for the state. Court advices the defendant to look for an attorney. Defendant asks for his bond to be converted to a signature bond. State objects. Court denies bond modification. Initial appearance set for May 6, 2022 at 1 PM

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

1:02 p.m. Appearances by Zoom video: Defendant from the jail, DA Harper for the State, and Atty. McGough as a limited appearance for purpose of the bail hearing. DA asks for $5k cash bond plus no drink conditions including no bars/taverns and test on demand. Atty. McGough argues for less. Court orders $2500 cash bond with the no drink/test/no bars. 3/16 at 4 p.m. for initial.
